course.title: Classical Mythology
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., at 11, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: The myths of the Greeks and Romans: creation myths, Greek gods, Greek heroes and Roman myths. Their relationship to the mythology of neighboring people (Hittites, Babylonians, Hebrews). Their importance for Greek and Roman societies and cultures. Their reception in literature and art from the ancient world to 21st century, and their importance as a foundation of our own modern culture and society. The course will be focused on the analysis of primary sources (read in translation) and works of art (literature, painting, sculpture, movies); ancient mythology will also be studied under the light of modern theories on mythology.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
